result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonchaa Marcell Mack

records.addlTxt: Order Releasing Competency Report, signed and filed.
Motion to Release Competency Report, filed.

Defendant Devonchaa Marcell Mack in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Devonchaa Marcell Mack.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Competency Hearing proceeded.  State does not challenge Dr. Niess' report.  Defense does challenge Dr. Niess' report.  Court qualified Dr. Niess to testify as an expert.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Jenna Niess.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.

After review of all evidence, report of Dr. Niess, and testimony of Dr. Niess, Court finds defendant incompetent to proceed at this time but is likely to become competent.  Court ordered defendant commitment for treatment for incompetency.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.  The sheriff shall arrange for transportation of the defendant to the treatment facility FORTHWITH. 

Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's report on 11/11/2022 at 9:00 AM in Branch 11.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Proposed Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

Defendant Devonchaa Marcell Mack in court, by zoom, with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Devonchaa Marcell Mack in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonchaa Marcell Mack appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for doctor's report return.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defendant contests the report.   Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Mack Report.  Received and Filed.  nk
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Devonchaa Marcell Mack in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Devonchaa Marcell Mack in custody at MSDF.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devonchaa Marcell Mack appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
